info.title: Cinema Ticket Server API
info.description: This is a clone api of cinematicket.org. We tried to implement as many features as we can.

get.description: Get an api key from the server. You need to provide this key in "apikey" header of your requests headers.

200.description: key generated successfully

post.description: This route is used for user signup.

requestBody.description: The "tel" field must contain 11 characters and the "password" field must contain at least 6 characters. "password" and "repeatPass" fields must be the same.

password.description: This field must contain at least 6 characters.

repeatPass.description: This field must be the same as password field.

200.description: The response Set-Cookie header contains two fileds: authToken (server-usage) and userData object (you can store it).

400.description: The inputs are probably incorrect. More information on the error will be sent to you on response. You can see the schema down this page.

post.description: This route is used for user login.

requestBody.description: The "login" field must be the user's tel or email and not be empty.

login.description: This field must contain user's tel or email.

200.description: The response Set-Cookie header contains two fileds: authToken (server-usage) and userData object (you can store it).

401.description: The "tel" or "password" field is incorrect. More information on the error will be sent to you on response. You can see the schema down this page.

400.description: The inputs you provided are not valid. More information on the error will be sent to you on response. You can see the schema down this page.

get.description: Use this route for getting any information on user's profile.

200.description: The values of these object properties depends on how complete the user's profile is. Apart from "tel" and "id" fields, the rest could be null.

id.description: The id of user in database.

first_name.description: User's first name. Needed for submission actions like writing a comments.

last_name.description: User's last name. Needed for submission actions like writing a comments.

birthday.description: This field is a Date(). It's converted to string by prisma so you may want to convert it back: new Date(birthday).

profile_pic_url.description: This is a relative path to the image web address. Use it like this: "{api-url}/img/{profile_pic_url}".

401.description: The JWT you provided is not valid. No error message will be provided.

put.description: Use this route to update user's profile information. You only need to send the fields you want to update, the rest of the fileds won't be updated.

requestBody.description: These are all the fields you can provide. There's no need to provide them all, just the ones you need to update. For the "img" field: the file has to be sent normally (not base64). File limitations: file size up to 2MB, supported formats are .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .webp.

tel.description: If provided, it can't be empty and must contain 11 characters.

birthday.description: If provided, you should convert your Date to string.

img.description: The image file to upload. Pay attention to the description provided above in the request body.

200.description: The response Set-Cookie header contains two fileds: authToken (server-usage) and userData object (you can store it). If the "tel" field was provided in the request body, you have to store the token, otherwise it's up to you (it's better you store it, since it's fresh and therefore the user has 90 days of logged in status).

400.description: The inputs you provided are not valid. More information on the error will be sent to you on response. You can see the schema down this page.

401.description: The JWT you provided is not valid. No error message will be provided.
